alert.note: Alert for Auglaize; Logan (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 4:16PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN LOGAN AND NORTHEASTERN AUGLAIZE COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM EDT... At 416 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Cridersville. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Wapakoneta, Fort Shawnee, Cridersville, Russells Point, Lakeview, Waynesfield, Chippewa Park, Uniopolis, Fryburg, New Hampshire and St. Johns. This includes I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 106 and 118. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
